intro: Psammogeton papillare, commonly known as the rough sandgrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Amaranthaceae family. It is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and bract-like structures that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a low-growing habit with linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Psammogeton papillare is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native range.
